TopicTitle: imgur images loading slowly? on a UK ISP? try this.

Articles.Content:
This whole week I've been having trouble viewing images which are hosted on Imgur and given how imgur is known for having load problems from time to time I just thought it was all imgur's fault.  
Turns out it's my lousy ISP, Plusnet. (although it may apply to other ISPs too)

If you are in UK with Plusnet as your ISP and images are loading like you're on a old style 56k dialup, try this test;

Go to http://imgur.com <-- slower than a braindead sloth
Go to https://imgur.com <- like a craft on re-entry (yeah, fast)

If you have the same outcome then you can install the HTTPS everywhere extension which will fix issues with images loading slowly on here, reddit and that one craft sharing site. 

I found a swarm of angry plustnetters on reddit and thankfully they had the answer - https://www.reddit.com/r/AskUK/comments/42npo1/imgur_loading_very_slowly_with_plusnet/ (the url has 42 in it, I feel this is significant somehow).

Edited January 31, 2016 by katateochi
solution might apply to other ISPs too

Go figure, I've been having the exact same problem.

It sounds like it may be related to the IWF. If so, it won't be the first time that filtering has mucked things up.

EDIT: The same issue occurred, again with imgur, with Sky Broadband in 2014. It's not just a Plusnet thing, I'd say basically every UK ISP either has had or will have a screwup like this.

Edited January 31, 2016 by cantab

15 hours ago, cantab said:

Go figure, I've been having the exact same problem.

It sounds like it may be related to the IWF. If so, it won't be the first time that filtering has mucked things up.

EDIT: The same issue occurred, again with imgur, with Sky Broadband in 2014. It's not just a Plusnet thing, I'd say basically every UK ISP either has had or will have a screwup like this.

The folk on reddit were also pointing fingers at IWF as at least part of the problem.  I've updated the thread title to reflect that it might be a more general UK ISP issue.

If thats an UK only issue, is it possible the cause is the censoring system installed a few years ago? While using HTTPS it could scan the transmited contents whicht akes time, with HTTPS it cant read it and can check it.
